66746.name: Threat Record (Vol 1, Issue 2 - Nov 2009)
66746.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Threat Record issue #2!
In this installment we delve into the mysterious world of the Martial Arts! We’ll learn about several styles that are popular in both fiction, and the real world. We will also be investigating several of the weapons used by martial artists from around the world. Further, each of our regular complement of five NPCs have a background in one form of martial arts, or another.

Threat Levels
Each NPC presented in Threat Record is rated with a Threat Level that will assist a Game Master in choosing the right villain to use against his or her group of super heroes. This level is a rank number that represents the NPC’s greatest offensive ability that will be used most often against the PCs. This can be the rank of a power, or one of the character’s Primary Attributes such as Melee, or Brawn.

Skills & Skill Levels
The skill rules, as presented in the 4C System rule manual, are basic. They are designed for use alongside the powers that a character may possess in a supers oriented setting. In Threat Record Issue #1, we introduced the concept of five levels of skill competency for use in both supers and non-supers campaigns. Though not considered “canon,” as far as the 4C System is concerned, this new skill system will be used in some future publications from Keck Publishing, and is also used with the NPCs created by Keck Publishing presented within these pages. The rules presented in Issue #1 of Threat Record are reprinted below. Publishers wishing to use them in their own productions are free to do so as they are considered public domain material.

66747.description:
The famous Monopoly game with the theme of the company ASML. Try to get a department of the ASML company and build your houses and hotels.

On the back of the box:
ASML wishes you and your family happy holidays in 2007, and a great 2008! We have created this ASML Special Edition of the popular boardgame, MONOPOLY, as a gift to ASML employees and their families this holiday season
66747.name: Monopoly: ASML Special Edition

66748.description:
A Monopoly like game. Try to buy DSM Business Units. When you got the whole set, you can buy plants. If another player lands on your DSM Business Units, you can collect money.
The last one standing when the others are broke, wins the game.
66748.name: Young DSM

66749.description:
From the publishers website...

"West Wind Productions and Grindhouse Games invite you to step into the world of the End Times with the first supplement to the insurgently successful Secrets of the Third Reich. In addition to containing new game rules, missions and background, this lavishly illustrated volume explores loads of exciting new character, support unit, and platoon options for all four major powers and delves deeply into irregular forces. Jump screaming from the skies with Crash Dixon and the US Jet Rangers. Assault a vampire’s lair with Paddy Mayne and the MI-13 Commandos. Marshal your horrific horde of Sturmzombies with the diabolical Gretel von X. Lead your stalwart Mecha Squadrons across the snowy plains with renowned Soviet mech ace Konstantin Samokhin. Raid the Axis supply lines as a desperate leader of the Free French Radwraiths. Do all this and oh, so much more."
66749.name: Secrets of the Third Reich: Doomsday

66750.name: Chasing the Dragon
66750.description:
From the Back Cover

The Combat Zone: The City's Heart of Darkness

A stolen attache case spells trouble unles the cyberpunks can find it,'cause someone is holding them responsible. This is no easy task in the Combat Zone. They're thrown into the middle of a dangerous game of corporate intrigue, greed, drug dealing and inter-game rivalry, and it is looking like nobody is on the team's side. Somewhere behind it all lurks the Dragon - the apparent thief, one of the best solos in the biz, and known to operate out of the Combat Zone. Chasing the Dragon through the worst (and perhaps most colorful) zone of the city, the team finds this enigma a wily opponent, and perhaps a most unlikely ally.

66751.name: Almeida
66751.description:
Game based on the small town of Vila de Almeida. Short listed in the Boulogne-Billancourt International Competition - Paris. The game rules and play draw their inspiration from the actual history and architecture of Vila de Almeida.

Almeida is a small town surrounded by two walls, making it very difficult to conquer. Not even an army is able to penetrate its defenses. The key to the town's defeat is the gunpowder magazine found in the castle. Six spies take advantage of the dark to enter the town undetected. Once inside they hope to conquer the castle. To do so they need to find a key hidden in the town. Will they be able to achieve their goal before sunrise? Will there be a double agent among them who will boycott the mission...?

The game is for 2 to 6 players, whose object is to enter the town's castle. To do so the player needs to find the key to the castle. For ages 8 and up. 30 minute game time.

Game box includes detailed information about the actual history which inspired the game. The rule book contains various illustrations to help learn the game and clarify all situations and rules.

66752.name: Euro
66752.description:
This game is a remake of "The Euro Game" shopping and sums by MAJORA.
For children from age 7 and up, the game teaches them how to deal with money and especially how to manage it. They’ll learn how to do a number of every day errands such as shopping, going to the bank, recycling, using a cash machine and crossing the street safely so they travel between the various places. The game is meant to be both educational and fun, so children can learn and grow, by doing things that usually belong to the domain of adults.

From the author: "Designing this game was a totally different challenge from inventing my other games. Actually, the game was meant to be a remake but when I started working on it, I made so many changes the game became a completely new one!
I tried to preserve the simplicity of the original game and keep the bills and coins the center of attention. New features were introduced, such as recycling and crossing the street safely. I hope this game is a source of fun and learning for all children and their parents. Have fun!"

66753.name: Wyspa
66753.description:
The goal of the game titled "Wyspa" (The Island) is to earn a million dollars. Players acquire raw materials, build houses, hotels and farms. The factories produce products that are later sold in the markets. Trade, negotiate, exchange - these are the basic rules and ways to win.

The game contains the following components:

- the board
- 125 plastic resources
- a set of company flags for each player
- 48 building tokens
- the deck of 33 event cards
- 1 round marker
- banknotes
- the rulebook

66754.description:
Fantasy-themed role-playing boardgame for the ill-fated electronic boardgame system YVIO. The players are dragons who try to rescue a pre-defined number of younglings from their collapsing dungeon (the more, the harder). Lots of side-quests and exciting dramatic main game, the console rolls the die, keeps track of the dragon's levels and quests, parts of the fights are a small dexterity game. The playing time can vary between one and four hours (depending on the number of players and the chosen difficulty level).

The magical land Tarascon: Imagine you are the last reminiscent of an ancient dragon race. Your task is now to protect the descendants of the tribe's mother Tarasque. Fight using magic, in direct combat and with strategic sophistication to prevent extinction.
Tarascon is a rpg-style board game designed for the Yvio console. You take the role of one of four dragons, each with different values in attack, defense and speed. Seated in the cave of Tarasque you'll have to pick up a dragon egg and take it to a nest. After a short while Yvio will inform you that there's a hatchling hiding in one of the rune chambers. Search for it and take it out of the cave to win the game (difficulty could be set to 2, 3 or 4 eggs, too).
During game play you will have to level-up your character, fight creatures and you can take on quests that the console is offering. You have to consider each decision wisely because the cave will start to crumble at some time during the game. If all the chambers are destroyed before one player fulfilled his task all players lose and Yvio wins.
66754.name: Yvio: Tarascon

66755.description:
Armalion is a fantasy strategy game (also known as tabletop), located in Aventuria, the world of the German role-playing game "Das Schwarze Auge" (Dark World).
One player plays an army of orcs, the other an army of knights. The playing field on which the armies are marshalled and moved, can range from a simple table to detail made landscapes.
Before the game begins, players decide which scenario is to be played. This may be a simple "last man standing"-battle, or a scenario containing certain tasks, such as to escort an important person or to defend a special building for a certain time.
Types and numbers of terrain pieces that are placed on the field, depend on the chosen scenario - the most common types are woodland, hills, roads, houses and fences.
66755.name: Armalion

66756.name: Magne-trix
66756.description:
A magnetic pendulum is suspended over a field of 8 blue and yellow magnets. Each player swings the pendulum 5 times. The game can be scored by adding the point value of the magnet over which the pendulum stops, or by betting which color magnet - yellow of blue - the pendulum will land on.

Instructions are in English, French, Danish, Finnish, German, and Swedish.

66757.name: Schützt unsere Umwelt!
66757.description:
Text on the box (translated from German):
The game:
Knowledge, guessing, imitating, laughing, rolling dice, tactics, luck ...
you really find everything in this game about life and environment!
It is exciting, fast and is fun to play again and again. Want to bet?

The game consists of a board showing a track of 60 spaces between "start" and "finish" and 3 places for certain piles of cards. Additionally the box contains 126 cards (66 "Pfiffikus", 30 "Rüffel" and 30 "Belohnung"), 64 reward marker, 1 bag made of cotton, 8 wooden figurines (4 girls and 4 boys, each in blue, red, yellow and green), 2 wooden dice (one to use and one for replacement) and a rulesheet.
Looking at the components it seems to be a fair simple game of "Roll and Move" (sorry, I don't have the rules). I guess that the shuffled cards have to be placed on the corresponding place on the gameboard from where a card is drawn and read to the player who ended up on a certain space. Each space of the running track shows one of 3 symbols: a question mark, an exclamation mark or an explosion bubble.
The question mark belongs to the Pfiffikus-cards. In this pile you find action cards giving you a special task to perform (like balancing a figurine on your left foot while walking once around the room) or question cards. The player receives reward chips for giving the right answer or fulfilling the action task.
Rüffel-cards are showing the exclamation mark. On them you find a description of what you might have done wrong (like wasting energy etc.) and the punishment you receive (lose markers, go back etc.).
Cards for Belohnung (meaning reward) are showing the bubble. They are listing exemplary behaviour and a reward for it.
Seems to me that you are winning when you reach the finish line and have more reward markers than the others.

66758.name: Jedi
66758.description:
Subtitle: The Pasteurized, Processed, Star Wars-type Role-Playing Game Product

Author's description:

Jedi is an original RPG that used to be based on the Star Wars universe. It is simple, complete, and has been over 25 years in the making. Rules cover Character Creation, Aliens, Droids, Combat, Skills, Vehicles and starships (of all sizes), Force Powers and skills, World Creation, and much more. Uses 6-sided exclusively for simplicity.

This game is available for free - there may never be a charge.

After my game was pretty much done, which was before West End Games had the license, I started hawking it to different game publishers, and tried getting permission to do so from Lucasfilm and Kenner (the holder of the game & toy rights at the time). Neither would talk to me until I got permission from the other. As I continued to push, I got a “friendly” little cease-and-desist order (Included at the end of the book) that scared the bejeebeez out of me. So I ceased and desisted. Until now.

All Star Wars indicia are the property of, ™ and © by Lucasfilm, Ltd. Their use is an homage to the rights holder's creativity, and is not meant as a challenge to their ownership in any way, shape or form.

66759.name: Front Rank...Fire!
66759.description:
Front Rank...Fire! The Zulu War 1879 - Skirmish Wargame Rules.

From the rulebook:

"These rules are intended for small unit actions, involving a handful of British and a larger force of Zulu. In general, odds of around 3:1 in favour of the Zulu produce a balanced game. The Zulu should be grouped into units of 20-40 figures each."

"Ground scale is 1 inch to 2 yards (ie. the same as the figure scale). Time scale is one move represents 6-8 seconds of real time. Figure representation is one figure to one man."

66760.name: Follow Me, Men!
66760.description:
Fantasy miniatures rules for fighting small-scale medieval fantasy battles using 25mm or 28mm figures. The players are represented by leader figures. Other figures (followers) are controlled by the leading figures through orders and actions. Each player typically controls six to twenty figures.

From the rulebook:

"These are rules for playing a wargame with toy soldiers. It is intended for several players - say 4 or more. Players control heroes (and, of course, heroines), who in turn have contingents of fighters under them."

"The setting for fantasy games is one of a sort of mixed dark ages/medieval European environment. Recommended reading for this are the Conan books, Tolkein's Middle Earth books and Terry Pratchet's Diskworld books. There are thousands of heroic fantasy books, of course, but if you've read these you will at least know where the author of the rules is coming from."

66761.description:
Hell on Wheels: Platoon Level Tank Tactics Game.

From the rulebook:

"The purpose of the game is to simulate the tactics and command and control problems facing individual tank troop/platoon commanders. Of necessity, such a game cannot expect to cover fully all aspects of tank combat at this level, and therefore I have chosen to gloss over the detail of the tank gun Vs armour battle, in favour of a more detailed communications and reactions system. Everything is very simple, but it is very difficult to do the simplest things."

"The game requires a minimum of two participants, Control and Player. The Control determines a fixed (or semi-fixed) defence for the player to fight through. Since such actions are likely to be fast and furious, there is often plenty of opportunity for Player and Control to swap roles. The Player is the commander of a single tank troop/platoon of whatever type the scenario dictates. These rules are written with the European campaign, 1944 in mind, but the structure can be applied to almost any tank engagement, with some small modifications."

"With more players, there is scope for larger games of up to squadron level, preferably with different units with their own terrain model. The back-to-back, two sided game
is also possible, but not recommended, since the detail necessary for correct interaction slows the game down considerably, and in my tests, the presence of a 'live' enemy made absolutely no difference to the players. It is recommended that when playing the higher level games, the ratio of 1:1 Player to Control is maintained if possible."

The game can be played with 1/300, 1/200, or 1/76 scale tanks. Each turn represents about 20-40 seconds. Each player represents one platoon/troop commander.
66761.name: Hell on Wheels

66762.name: Pentox
66762.description:
A challenging game of strategy. For 2 players, aged 7 years-adult.

The game components are:

- a hardwood box
- 25 wooden cubes, each with 4 blank faces, one face marked with a black circle, and 1 face with a white circle
- rules
The object of Pentox is as simple as noughts and crosses. The winner is the first person to make a straight line - horizontal, vertical or diagonal - with 5 cubes of the same colour.

The cubes are emptied out of the box and arranged in a 5x5 square with the blank faces upwards.

Each player chooses a colour, either black or white.

Play commences by the first player choosing any of the 16 cubes on the periphery of the square, but they may only choose a square that is showing a blank face OR showing a circle of the players chosen colour.

Depending on where the player has taken the cube from, the incomplete row must be made good by sliding any one of up to three possible blank rows into the empty space, by using the selected cube to push the other end of the row. The cube used to push the row is then left at the end of the row with that players colour face upwards.

The opponent then replies in a similar fashion.
Play continues until one player manages to form a straight line - either horizontal, vertical or diagonal - of 5 cubes of their colour,

66763.name: Tank Duel
66763.description:
An umpired, dual blind miniatures wargame of a battle between two opposing tanks. Two four-player teams represent the opposing tank crews, portraying the commander, gunner, loader, and driver.

From the rulebook:

"The purpose of the game is to simulate, in a simple but realistic way, the problems confronting the crew of an individual tank in combat. To make the game even more difficult, the action takes place between two or more crews, in a sort of stylised 'duel'. Obviously, such one-on-one duels practically never took place, but these games are intended more as a sort of teamwork game, to illustrate a point. There is no reason why the game cannot be expanded to take on larger actions of up to troop level."

"Any scale of model can be used, although it is important that the turrets of the tank models can be rotated independently. For reasons which become apparent later, 1/200 is probably the smallest practical scale, and 1/72 or 1/90 are probably the ideal scales."

"It is vitally important that the terrain scale is the same as the model scale, ie. for 1/72 the ground scale would be 1" = 2 metres."

"Each 'bound' of activity takes 4-5 seconds of real time, and represents approx 10-15 seconds of game time."

"Each player represents one crew member."

66764.description:
Sophonisba and the Battle of Great Plains is an expansion module for SQPR in GMT Games' Great Battles of History Series. It is a tactical simulation of a combat from the late Second Punic War on African soil in which Scipio's Roman army met a combined Carthaginian and Numdian force in an area 75 miles southwest of Utica called The Great Plains. The Carthaginians were lead by Hannibal's less famous brother, Hasdrubal, and the Numidians by King Syphax.

Sophonisba is Hasdrubal's own daughter offered in marriage to Syphax to ensure Numdia's continued loyalty after the defection of their cavalry general, Masinissa.

To play Sophonisba and the Battle of Great Plains, you will need SQPR "II", the second edition rules (from 1994).
The needed counters can be found in SQPR and in the module counter sheet included in C3i #4. (Some counters from the War Elephant and Africanus modules are reproduced in the C3i that players without those scenarios can play Sophonisba.) The Cannae map from SPQR is also required as it resembles the Great Plains battlefield.
66764.name: Sophonisba and the Battle of the Great Plains: SPQR Module

66766.name: STONK
66766.description:
STONK: Brigade-Level Combat - Europe 1944.

This set of detailed miniatures rules is suitable for use with any miniatures that can accommodate a terrain scale of 1cm=40m. Each turn equals about ten minutes of real time. Units represent infantry platoons, armor troops, and artillery batteries.

From the rulebook:

"This is a set of wargame rules intended to simulate actions between about one brigade equivalent a side, supported by divisional or even corps troops where they would have been available."

"In STONK the focus is on the operations of companies - with platoons and heavy weapons as the smallest units separately represented."

"This is shown on the table top by models on a base of the appropriate size - the exact number or models per base can be varied to meet your own taste and financial resources - the game is perfectly playable without models at all, substituting counters for the models."

rpg: Judge Dredd the Roleplaying Game (MGP Traveller)
66767.name: Bad Moon Rising
66767.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The first complete adventure for Judge Dredd, Bad Moon Rising starts with a quiet, humdrum investigation for the Judges, but it soon becomes apparent that the crimes being committed are anything but normal.

Why are murders being conducted seemingly at random? Why are the Narks suddenly silent? I this a new plot against Mega-City One? Or a very, very old one?

rpg: Judge Dredd the Roleplaying Game (MGP Traveller)
66769.name: Judge's Handbook
66769.description:
Publisher's blurb:


Uncover the secrets of the Justice Department in Mega-City One. Within this book, you will find all the methods, technologies and procedures the judges use to track down criminals. From the forensics of Tek-Div to the Manta Prowl Tank, there is a tool to solve every crime, and your judges have access to them all.


The Judge's Handbook provides new rules and options for judges as they patrol the streets of Mega-City One, and allows them access to the more elite divisions and promotions, allowing them to become Exorcist Judges, join the holocaust Squad, or even Acc-Div! If that is not enough to complete an investigation, then the judges will be happy to try out the latest weapons and equipment, straight from the workshops of Tek-Div.

66770.name: Le Jeu du Monde
66770.description:
LE IEV DV MONDE dedié A Monsieur le Comte de Viuone, Premier Gentilhomme de la Chambre du Roy, par son treshumble tres obeissant Seruiteur Du Val, A Paris chez l'auteur P. Du Val d'Abbeville, Auec Priuillege du Roy 1645 Et se vendent Rue St. Jacques a l'Esperance.

The game contains two maps in the centre, one of the Old World, one of the New, the latter showing but naming the Southern Continent. The first square shows the Polar World, with small, individual maps of the 'Terres Arctiques' and the 'Terres Antarctiques'.

The publication of a new set of rules, a Nouvelle Explication de jeu du monde (Paris 1650) suggests that the game remained popular over a number of years.

66771.description: Europe, 1348. The Black Death ravages Europe. Until now the players have used the help of a handful of different medieval classes to fight the plague. Now it’s time to call for reinforcements. 12 new personalities are ready to provide their help to the players. Some of these, like the Queen and the Emperor, use their wealth and power to aid the players. Some, like the Nun and the Bishop, use wisdom and faith to avoid the plague, while others resort to magic and witchcraft, like Pied Piper, who uses his magical flute to lure the rats along with him.
66771.name: Rattus: Pied Piper

66772.name: Jeu de la Sphère ou de l'Universe, selon Tycho Brahe
66772.description:
The game is concerned not only with terrestrial geography but with the structure of the cosmos. A map at the gameboard shows Europe, Asia, Africa, the eastern extremity of South America and the 'Terre Antarctique'.

A later edition published 1671.

66773.name: Mappe-monde ou Carte Générale de toutte la Terre
66773.description: A simple roll-and-move race game from Paris around the world and back to Paris, using a track of 80 squares, which impose various penalties and bonuses to those landing on them. Drawn under the observations of the French Royal Academy of Sciences, the centre of the gameboard is occupied by maps of the Eastern and Western Hemispheres. The 'Terre Antarctique' is described as an 'Unknown land situated in the southern part of the Globe comprised of New Guinea, New Zealand and New Holland'. A specific penalty is imposed on players so unfortunate to land on the Barbary Coast. They are to remain there for two turns 'because of the trade in Christian slaves which is carried on there', but they can be released by the arrival of another player on the same square.

66774.name: La Géographie Universelle ou la Connoissance Exacte de la Mappemonde
66774.description:
The globe, with the western and eastern hemispheres, are shown at the gameboard of this roll-and-move game printed in Paris.

Reprinted in 1780. By this date James Cook (1728-1779) had radically mofified the known face of he Pacific, but this is not reflected at the gameboard. Perhaps because of the cost involved in engraving a new plate.

66775.name: Jeu Instructif des Peuples et Costumes des Quatre Parties du Monde et des Terres Australes
66775.description:
[An educational game about peoples and clothes in the four parts of the world and Australia]

A roll-and-move game with 63 squares, where the journey begins in China and ends in the heart of Paris. Compositions allegorical of Europe, Africa and America fill the four outer corners, while the rules occupy the centre. The warmth of the Tahitian welcome is reflected, because all players who touch Tahiti must stay and miss two turns. New Zealand is described as the most terrible land to visit, because the penalty is to start again from square 1.

66776.name: Jeu de Nations
66776.description: Medallion maps of eleven European countries for an oval in the centre of the gameboard, while the outer corners are occupied by groups of figures from Asia, Africa, America and Oceania. The latter consists of tattooed figures very freely interpreted.

66777.name: Charades
66777.description: This games comes with the word cards, a spinner to decide which "version" of the game you will play that round, and score sliders. It comes in a one-piece (except for the cards) blue clamshell in a box. You pick a card and spin the two-hole spinner -- one hole indicates whether you are using "talking only" of if you are performing charades. and the opposite hole, if you land on the words version, will tell you how many words you are allowed to use (in which case your team is allowed "one minute" to guess after you finish saying the 6 - 9 words allowed, but the game does not come with a timer). Winning requires 10 rounds.

66778.description: A simple racing game using a spinner for movement. The "new" in the title came from the idea of having each player start from a different point and follow a different route to the finish point. An exact spin is necessary to reach the end of the race at Centerville.
66778.name: The New Bicycle Game

boardgamehonor: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best Science-Fiction or Fantasy Board Wargame Nominee
66781.description:
Official website

http://zak965.it/spaceinfantry/index.html

Summary

Space Infantry (SI) is a solitaire game of squad-level combat in the future. In Space Infantry you control a team of 4/8 soldiers on a series of missions that can be played individually or as a campaign.
Each mission takes about 20 minutes to be completed.

SI is a modular game; the overall structure of SI will make it possible to easily add new features to the game (missions, enemies, equipment): this means that in the future additional components will add new options to the existing missions, increasing the lifetime of SI.

SI started as a free game, and has now been published by Lock'n Load games - go to http://locknloadgame.com/ for more details

Game Includes:


Rulebook
4 Mission Maps (double-sided)
12 Hive Sector Tiles
18 Unit Cards
4 Enemy Sheets/Time Tracks (double-sided)
2 Squad Rosters
2 Campaign Logs
158 Die-cut Counters
66781.name: Space Infantry
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Twenty One of The Gaming Gang

66786.name: Fast 111's Card Game
66786.description:
It's a fast-paced race through the U.S.A. along a route that you create. Lay out the license plate cards of the states you will pass through...choose your Fast 111's racer cards...and the competition is on! Try to leave your opponents "in the dust" while you build up your own speed. Hit the maximum and you're on to the next state. The speed and excitement of car-racing...all in a card game. The first one to complete the route wins the game.

This is a card game version of the board game of the same name.

66787.name: Ice Cream Scoops of Fun (2008 Version)
66787.description:
This 2008 version of Mattel's Fisher-Price branded Ice Cream Scoops of Fun is similar in appearance to their discontinued 2000 version (see Ice Cream Scoops of Fun); but has sufficiently different rules, pieces, and mechanics to make this a different game.

The object is to be the first player to get four scoops of ice cream. Each player, in turn, uses the Ice Cream Scooper to randomly pick one of three ice cream flavors, yells out the flavor picked, and flips over one of the face-down Ice Cream Scoop Cards; if it's a match, the player adds the scoop to their bowl after screaming "Ice Cream!" otherwise the scoop is flipped back face-down.

Basically this is a preschooler-oriented memory-matching game where what you want to match is picked randomly and you get to do a lot of shouting.

66788.name: Hidden City Philadelphia
66788.description:
Hidden City, the card game, brings the rich stories of Philadelphia's neighborhoods to life.

In this game of urban development, the winner is the first to create a community chock full of art, food, and history - the cultural life of every city. Along the way, you will discover landmarks, meet local citizens, and see Philly in a whole new way.

The object is to manage your resources in order to build up your favorite neighborhoods. Along the way meet local citizens, visit landmarks, and see Philadelphia as you never have before! Every player needs their own deck to play, and one deck per person.

66790.name: Shadis (Issue 43 - Dec 1997)
rpgissuearticle: Building of an Empire - Tips and Guidelines for Creating Unforgettable Campaigns
Mud, Sweat, Tears - A Wild Adventure for Shadowrun
The Crucible - Miniature Scenarios and Reviews
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly
66790.description:
Month of publication unspecified

Volume 6, No. 6

Cover by Sergio Aragonés

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.`

66796.name: Pyramid (Issue 13 - May 1995)
66796.description:
The first of six perfect-bound issues.

Contents

Yrth 1100 by Steffan O'Sullivan and Ann Dupuis
Welcome to the Ice Age by John Tynes
I Was a Teenage Dinosaur by James Cambias
INWO Update
"Ritual Center" by Phil Masters and Alison Brooks
Pyramid Picks

Hunters from the Sky
Iron Dragon
Aria
Doomtrooper




County Seat Wars & Campaigns by Robert Collins
Rune Mysteries — Again! by Bruce Kvan

Regular Features
Second Sight
Industry News
SJG News
Upcoming Releases
Angels in the Architecture
Supporting Cast
Bruno!
AADA News
Origins Awards Ballot
Murphy's Rules
Q&A
Convention Calendar
Index to Advertisers

Ron Spencer is credited as Ron "Spenser"

boardgamehonor: 2011 Golden GeekBest Children's Board Game Nominee
66797.description:
Kids have been waiting for this a long time: Eventually, the fun the older players are having with Pickomino is now also available for the younger ones – in a charming, funny, and perfectly age-based dice game: Heckmeck Junior.

The player, who can roll the tastiest ingredients for his Mac Heck burger on the six dice, becomes “Worm King of the Day”. Cucumbers, cheese, and ketchup make the chicken wings of our young poultry flutter for joy. If you manage to acquire many different delicacies throughout your dice rolls you may put a lot of tasty roast worms onto your plate. In case your desired treat has already been taken from the grill, though, you may of course also eat from your opponents’ plates.

The main difference between Pickomino and the junior version is that besides the inevitable worms, the dice have different food symbols (cheese, ketchup, rolls) on them instead of numbers, and the tiles have one-digit numbers that are easier to count.
66797.name: Heckmeck Junior

66798.description:
On the highest fun level, "Heckmeck BBQ" features thrilling dice-rolling for roast worms. The game board (newly introduded to the world of Pickomino) invites the players to 14 different BBQ sites. In order to conquer those desired sites, a player puts aside all identical symbols from his dice roll and continues rolling the remaining dice. As soon as his dice roll result reaches the value of an empty BBQ site, he may broil and eat his worms there. However, the opponent players may also establish themselves at the same site (it's another difference from Pickomino) and claim the tasty worms. And only at very precious BBQ sites players can find the latest BBQ trend: roast snails.

Packed in an attractively styled "BBQ Dice", the game not only fascinates worm-loving Pickomino fans. The new dimension of the "Worm Universe" in "Heckmeck BBQ" also lets players who haven`t tried any tasty worms yet discover their desire for roast snails.
66798.name: Heckmeck Barbecue

66799.description:
“Flinke Stinker” is a funny animal memory race with beautiful game pieces in a hilarious skunk world. The players are revealing cards. In order to move their skunks forward as quickly as possible they try to find “the right way” in the form of skunk tracks.

However, every once in a while, the ravenous puma appears. Smart as it is, it just pinched off its
nose, thus, it doesn’t need to pay attention to the smell of the skunks and can easily thwart them.

Then you give all collected track cards to the other players and try to memorize where the puma lurks. Stinking boots, mud holes and old cheese are further obstacles that have to be avoided.

Only alert players can find the right tracks around the puma and can also overtake other skunks. Once overtaken and provided with the opponent’s scent, a skunk is sent back a couple of spaces.

The player whose skunk reaches the final tile first wins.
66799.name: Flinke Stinker

66803.name: Vanguard: Rome
66803.description:
Vanguard: Rome is a military card game where you will command the great Roman army in civil war against your former allies! Order your battle line strategically and command your units bravely to ensure Victory!

Vanguard: Rome is a positional strategy game where the order of your cards is just as important as the cards themselves. Strategy and forward thinking are paramount as there are many different possible moves each turn, allowing players to command their army towards victory!

Game Includes:
Units Deck (60 Cards)
Commands Deck (40 Cards)
Vanguard Rome: Rules Document

Website @ http://www.friedmonkeygames.com

Purchase @ http://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/vanguard:-rome

Rules @ http://s3.amazonaws.com/files.thegamecrafter.com/547213fc521...

YouTube@ http://www.youtube.com/user/FriedMonkeyGames

66807.name: Avatar
66807.description:
From the game's introduction:

Avatar is a character based role playing game. It aims to be as flexible as possible, in terms of setting, by including an innovative World Building game and by basing action firmly around characterisation by means of a system of personality traits that build a realistic picture of the character for player and Gamesmaster alike.

Avatar uses open-ended combat and magic systems, which constantly refer back to these character templates to ensure the personality has a real and important effect on the game scenario. The rules assume some previous experience with role playing games, and many common gaming conventions are used without explanation (for example, 1d20 for the value obtained from rolling a twenty sided dice).

The system aims for fast, simple, easily resolvable rules management, with a minimum of in-play table reference. Once the basics have been understood, game-play should be slick, favouring character interaction over number crunching.

66808.name: Shifter
66808.description:
From the game's introduction:

The Game

Shifter is a role playing game based around a society in the far future so improbable that they have to send interdimensional demolition experts back in time to ensure that it continues to exist. Travelling between different versions of reality, these Shifters stabilise and destabilize different timelines - known as variants - by tampering with history. Along the way, they come into conflict with Rogue Shifters, and Shifters sent from different timelines, bent on eliminating the players' version of history entirely.

The Players

As a professional Shifter you are trained (albeit not very well) for the complex task of Shifting. Choose between the four standard Specialities - Gaunt, Teknic, Psyker and Seer - or create your own. Because of the near-infinite variety of different timelines, there are no limits to who or what your character is - from a clone of Elvis to a sentient pizza. For 2 or more players aged 18 or over with plenty of beer and snack food on hand. At least one deck of playing cards will be required.

The Rulebook

The rules cover a wide variety of topics including:

Creating Shifters. Fast and detailed character generation system.
Task resolution. Unbelievably fast and unrealistic game mechanics using a deck of cards to simulate the strange laws of the Shifter universe.
All the rules you need to play plus many you don't - including the vital Emergency Gamesmaster Instructions, for when you are just too drunk to work out what happens next.
Pick up and run - most games require little preparation.
Includes two pre-prepared missions.
Warning! This product contains some unnecessary bad language.

66809.description:
Flying Lead can be used to play tabletop actions in a wide range of genres. From gang warfare to Pulp action, from military operations to black-clad assassins, Flying Lead supplies furious fun at bullet speed! Lead a gang of mobsters, play cops vs crooks, or enter the brutal world of covert special operations and espionage.

But will you have the guts to lead your force to glory in world where a street punk or an armed fanatic can blow you away as effectively as a trained soldier? Pick your force, roll those dice and find out!

Flying Lead takes the award-winning Song of Blades and Heroes mechanics into, and even beyond, the modern world of high-powered projectile weapons. These core rules will enable you to play using a small table area and a handful of figures. By using our online force, weapon and vehicle generators, players will be able to customize their characters and get playing straight away.

you will find rules for:

* hand-to-hand and ranged combat
* vehicular combat
* projectile weapons
* grenades
* morale
* advances
* profiles for cops, crooks, the Mafia, pulp characters, SWAT teams, Special Ops and WWII soldiers, insurgents, terrorists, and more

The rules can be played in any scale, with five to 15 models per player; a standard game takes around 45-60 minutes once you know the rules.
66809.name: Flying Lead

66812.name: Classic College & Pro Basketball
66812.description:
The game can be played solitaire or head-to-head. Players are individually carded and rated based upon their actual statistics and produce a true to life representation of their playing tendencies.

It has been produced for the past five years and has over 1000 D1 college basketball teams available form the 2005-2013 seasons including all the mens Final Four teams from 1976-2013. In addition, 18 NBA seasons have been carded. Cards are also available for the 2008 Mens Olympic basketball teams.

The game box and components are four-color and professionally printed.

66813.name: Dark Clouds of War (Cursed Empire)
66813.description:
From the Back Cover:

Dark Clouds of War

Here you have it, the third Cursed Empire Dark Fantasy Role Playing Game Supplement. Cover artwork is by Rob Larson who did the superb art for the Sourcebook, Slavers of Karg and Darkun Supplement covers, interior art is by Rob Larson, Rik Martin and Amandine Labare.

A storm is gathering over the Black forest. the region ia as yet apparently neutral in the conflict between the Empire and Karnarcos. Could the Rlishae (Dusk Elves) be preparing an attack on Karg? All the signs are there in any case. As agents of Karnarcos, you will have to verify the level of the threat and report back to your supperiors.

The Master of Tales can run the scenario included as is or populate it with additional material as detailed below.

This supplement includes additional background material on the Druid and Druid-Priest (evil Druids) with new spells, Non-Player Characters, Gatherings (Bears, Custodians, Hawks etc.) and Brotherhoods (Kaegrenn, Magdaelenn, Predictors etc.). The backgorund provided also develops Rlishan Society and politics, with a host of Non-Player Characters, Castes and Noble Families

66814.name: Bob de Bouwer: Help Bob eruit!
66814.description: Bob the Builder is so much focus on building a chimney, that he does not notice that he has himself immured here! The players must now put away brick by brick the chimney to help Bob out. The players take turns with their trowels to pull the bricks away. If Bob remains in the chimney, the turn is over. But if Bob jumps out of the chimney, the current player wins.

66819.description:
Oh how wild is Africa! Cards depicting animals (a lion, giraffe, elephant, zebra,...) are dealed. Then each player on his turn plays one of his cards in to one of the two matching card decks. A player who can play a card on his turn stays in the round; one who doesn't has to pass for this round. The final player to pass in a round wins one of the two decks. The player that in the end has the most different animals wins.
Zanzibar is the 2009 original edition. Wilde Bande is the German translation, edited by Amigo in 2010.
66819.name: Zanzibar

66820.name: Puppy Pounders
66820.description:
Tactical "Miniatures" Rules for Stuffed Animals

This is probably the pre-cursor to Fuzzy Heroes.

From the rules intro:
There she sits, adorable, fuzzy, and as snug as the cat who ate the canary. She knows you can't blame her - she's just too cute. Yet, where did the rest of the stuffed animals disappear to?? All you found were small piles of stuffing and plush material. Your little stuffed dog could not possibly have done all that. Unless, just maybe, she's discovered the rules for that new game you had hidden under the bed. The rules for ... PUPPY POUNDERS

boardgamehonor: 2010 Deutscher Spiele Preis Best Children's Game Winner
2010 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
2010 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Nominee
2011 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Enfant Winner
2011 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
2012 Guldbrikken Best Children's Game Nominee
66825.description: With their research ship each player looks to discover animals in the sea. But look out for the big kraken because he will try to entangle your ship in his arms. The game features an innovating tilting mechanism (this is activated when a ship gets caught by the kraken). The player who discovers as many different animals as possible wins the game.
66825.name: Kraken-Alarm

66829.name: How To Blow Up The World
rpg: How To Blow Up The World
66829.description:
From the game's introduction:

A post-apocalyptic roleplaying game.

How To Blow Up The World. That's a plain enough title, isn't it?

This is a role-playing game about the post-apocalypse genre. The post-apocalypse genre, while it has its roots in older speculative and disaster fiction, is one that has only seen real definition in the last fifty years, after the World Wars and during the Cold War. It is one of the few genres to be created in the last few decades, and it has inspired movies, literature, animation, and comics, and it has seen a recent upswing thanks media-inspired fears of an upcoming apocalypse. Is it going to be North Korea? Islamic terrorists? Home-grown loonies? God's wrathful hand? Or maybe it's just going to be the Commies all over again!

While some roleplaying games have covered individual apocalyptic settings, no individual roleplaying game has tried to cover the genre as a whole, doing what Dungeons & Dragons has done for fantasy or Alternity did for science-fiction. In How To Blow Up The World, we present several scenarios for survivable apocalyptic events, and support in both advice to run them, and rules to play them with. The basis of the How-To rule system assumes a (formerly) real-world setting based on real-world technology, such as in Alas, Babylon and Y: The Last Man. However, it also weaves in support for various types of futuristic and supernatural characters and technology.

66832.name: Secrets of Pact Magic
66832.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tap the Power of Ancient Spirits and Eternal Elements

Lure ancient spirits to bargain for their power. Secrets of Pact Magic is a complete guide for the use of pact magic in your d20 System game, as inspired by medieval Goetian magic. A pact mage summons a vestige of an ancient spirit to bargain for the brief use of its terrible power.

Over one hundred spirits, including elemental and epic spirits, wait to be bound. Each spirit receives a two-page layout with geometric seal, legend, ritual, granted abilities, side-effects, tactical bonuses, and more.

A spellcaster can swap spells for a spirit. Included are new races and base classes such as the pact warrior, occult priest, and unbound witch. In addition to feats, spells, prestige classes, creatures, and magic items, thirteen organizations are keyed to constellations of spirits. Game masters can send players to the Apocryphal Desert, the Ravaged Sea, and the Outer Darkness.

66833.name: Villains of Pact Magic
66833.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Vile Foes to Test Your Eternal Soul

This 212-page, fully-illustrated hardcover book offers players and GMs a treasure trove of material for adventures revolving around the discovery and use of pact magic. Includes dozens of new bindable spirits, monstrous foes, spells, feats, traps and puzzles, terrain zones, magic items, adventure hooks, and adventure sites. Introduces the Exorcist, Muse, Ravaged Soul and Templar base classes, available for use as PCs or as inscrutable, recurrent villains that grow alongside PCs over multiple adventures. GMs will also find ready-to-run in-depth material on divine foes of binders — Penitent Hounds and Confessors — plus secrets of the ancient and arrogant Atlans, lurking cultists of the Nightfang Weald, and terror-inducing encounters with menacing cyclopes of the Outer Darkness. Meant for use with Secrets of Pact Magic, but may be used stand-alone.

66834.name: Pact Magic to Pathfinder RPG Conversion Guide
66834.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a quick guide to convert material from Secrets of Pact
Magic and Villains and Pact Magic for use in Paizo’s Pathfinder
Role-Playing Game (http://www.paizo.com).

66835.name: Nickel & Dime Pool
66835.description:
Nickel & Dime Pool is a dexterity, flicking game based on pool. Coins are used in place of balls. They are "flicked" with your finger instead of using a pool cue. A larger, nickel-sized coin is used as the cue ball and 10 dime-sized coins represent the rest of the balls. The small coins are split into 2 groups, solids and stripes. One player/team uses solids, numbered 1-5, the other uses stripes, numbered 6-10. The goal is to be the first player/team to sink all of their respective coins into the pockets. The board is square, molded plastic with 6 pockets. 1 at each of the 4 corners and 1 one along either side midway down the board. Just like billiards, the cue coin is used to sink the other coins into the pockets by flicking it into the numbered coins.

Game comes with board, 11 coins, plastic triangular rack and vinyl pouch to hold coins. Vinyl decals are supplied to apply to the coins, representing the different numbered balls, 1-10.

66836.name: Mt Kilajava
66836.description:
Welcome to the world of Mt. Kilajava, the first board game from Christchurch-based Monsoon Games that combines the spirit of competitive gaming with a rare insight into the realities of global trade.

You have arrived at the slopes of Mt Kilajava, a bare but fertile volcano, to establish a coffee farm. Your opponent arrives at the same moment, and has the same idea... The race is on! Who can successfully grow more coffee on the land available?

This is a fun, strategy-based board game for two players. Unfolding events maintain the suspense until the very end - storms, eruptions and price crashes will claim a lot of coffee along the way.

Mt. Kilajava also makes an important point; that for farmers in the developing world growing coffee is a very precarious occupation, and slumps in world coffee prices can and do have a catastrophic effect on the lives of millions of growers who are reliant on coffee for their income.

With some skill, daring and a measure of good luck you can enjoy watching your opponent lose their coffee to plummeting world prices. On the way you will also gain an insight into the real story behind your double shot cappuccino.

"Games first and foremost have to be fun to play, but I think they can also help us better understand and appreciate the world around us," says creator (and Trade Aid coffee buyer) Justin Purser.

66837.description:
1862: Railway Mania in the Eastern Counties is an 18xx game set in East Anglia, England. It features a company-packed board, where 16 of 20 companies are randomly selected for use on a board containing only 37 hexes. Major features of the game are:


Petitioning parliament as a means of floating your preferred company
a mixture of full and partial capitalisation for companies
three train types with differing objectives and building requirements
company mergers and re-floatation
1860-style semi-linear stock-market featuring multiple stock jumps.
66837.name: 1862: Railway Mania in the Eastern Counties

66839.name: Operation Peregrine
66839.description:
From the publisher:

Space Opera: Operation Peregrine - The Quanchiovt Conspiracy

"ASSIGNMENT: BREAK A CRIMINAL SYNDICATE A religious leader is kidnapped and the trail leads the adventurers through a variety of worlds on the track of a syndicate. Criminal masterminds running illegal drugs and operating production facilities on many worlds are involved. These types of people have money and a ruthless nature in covering up their activities. The player characters will find that their foes will stop at nothing, even disrupting the annual Sky Cruiser Race on Grutzom. It all makes for an exciting, multi-part adventure of danger and intrigue. Also included in OPERATION PEREGRINE is a complete quadrant of a star sector. Maps and commercial starship routes accompany the descriptions of the planets in this quadrant. "

66841.name: Stock ~ Split
66841.description: Stock ~ Split is an economic game designed to teach players about the stock market. The game board has a slider to keep track of stock prices, allowing for variability between plays. Players move about the board by rolling dice, but different places offer different movement, depending on what was rolled (an even or odd for example.) Players buy and sell stock as the game progresses - there is no credit allowed in the game so if a player runs out of money then he or she is eliminated. The player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.

66842.name: Ocaso Zombie
66842.description:
TONIGHT, THE DEAD WALK AGAIN ... THEY ARE HUNGRY FOR YOU!

Fear invades you as you move, unsure of what just lies around the corner... hold your breath, don´t make a noise, yo feel as if the beating of your heart you will delate you, perhaps the next building is safe, or maybe you are haeding towards a trap, but you know you can't stop, you must continue moving forward, looking for a way out.

Explore the city, moving through the zombie infested streets, you will discover the different locations as you go forward; collect weapons that will help you eliminate the hordes of voracious zombies chasing you. look for items that are necesary in your espae in one of the vehicles ... flee before they turn you into another one of the walking dead!

PLAYERS
4 players, ages 12 and older

COMPONENTS
64 playing cards:
8 characters cards
22 locations cards
30 situations/items cards
4 life points tracking cards
36 zombie counters:
12 1 zombie counters
12 3 zombies counters
12 6 zombies counters
4 life points tracking counters
4 playing pieces
2 dice (not included in the PRINT'n'PLAY version)

OCASO ZOMBIE (ZOMBIE SUNSET)
The goal of the game is to survive the ZOMBIE SUNSET, obtaining the resources needed to use any of the ways out.

The game ends in two ways:
1. All players are killed (If there are no more ALIVE players, the game ends, even if there are still players in ZOMBIE state).
2. All players (ALIVE) escape from the city.

THE CARDS
CHARACTERS:
In them you will find the different features of your character, and some special skills to enhance your offense, defense or other actions.

LOCATIONS:
These are cards that from the game map, in them you will find red arrows that indicate the access points of each locations, you can join the cards together with each other with this access points, allowing you to create a different map for each game.

SITUATIONS AND ITEMS:
In these cards you will find different scenenarios that you must solve to move through the different locations, and you will also

66843.name: Dorn: Koschei's Eternal Return
66843.description:
First expansion for the boardgame Dorn.

Koschei the Deathless is the new boss in the Expansion. He moves freely on the board and keeps resurrecting. The heroes need to open the gate and destroy the magical egg where the Koschei keeps his heart.

There are five new heroes to choose from, a druid, a troubadoure, a thief, a psionic and a barbarian. There are also five new hideous monsters to play with. The evil side can also build totems, which cannot move but give bonuses to surrounding monsters.

There are new Treasures, Blessings and Rituals, but also each hero is given a specific personal quest. If he completes it, he gets a special reward. The evil side also has similar quests.

Home page: http://www.dorn.cz (Czech)

66844.name: Awesome!
66844.description:
Publisher (Designer) Blurb:
"Awesome! is a game of telling a story about just how awesome your characters are, and how they kick ass and take names accomplishing mighty feats of derring-do, blockbuster action movie style! For Awesome! characters, the question is not whether they succeed, only how awesome their success is!"

66845.name: Shadowland (Issue 1 - Oct/Nov/Dec 1995)
rpgissuearticle: The Gross-Frankfurt Sprawl (Part 1: Frankfurt am Main)
66845.description:
Although this is a magazine, the page numbering starts on the first page, excluding the covers.

Cover Art: Bottled Demon by John Zeleznik

66846.name: Dulse
66846.description:
Publisher (Designer) Blurb:
Dulse is a game about relationships, ideals, and the choices we make to preserve or destroy them.

In addition to being the name of the game, Dulse is also a character – one who is literally central. The events that inform play, and the other three characters, revolve around Dulse.

Across five life-changing events, you and your friends will explore the sacrifices and betrayals of four people who’ve known each other their entire lives, and who have deep-seated needs that they can’t fill alone. Along the way you’ll make hard choices between competing ideals, and have more choices made for you. In the end, you will face an uncertain future guided only by a shared past.

66847.description:
"Two restaurants are fighting to earn the customer's trust for their food service, the quality of their dishes and the good recipes they are preparing.

5 customers, trying to choose on wich one will stay this night for their dinner.

2 shefs trying to stay calm , to remember where the raw materials are and to suggest a dish from their menu to each customer.

Finally the best restaurant wins the medal of the demanding gastronomic and prospective customer"

A card game for two players that combines sharp mind,strategy and alot of cooking!

3 Table Boards
5 Customers tiles
37 Cards
24 Medal parts
1 Illustrated rule book

Microbadge

Buy It
66847.name: NF's Gourmet

66848.name: Evidence in Action
66848.description:
The board game, which is similar to Snakes and Ladders, was developed as part of the World Health Organization evidence-based reproductive health care training package. It is an innovative and creative method, which enables participants to put into action the knowledge gained from a preceding training workshop. It can also be used as a stand-alone learning tool. The game was developed with a rural setting in mind, highlighting some of the logistical and health-related problems encountered in under-resourced countries
In the game the players need answer correctly the questions about Health Care.
The game is a roll and move and each position has a question about the theme.

www.mrc.ac.za/cochrane/boardgame.htm

boardgamehonor: 2011 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
66849.description:
From the publisher Zoch:

“Safranito” is an extraordinary action-filled game that challenges skillful tactics as well as tactical dexterity.

Like no other game before, “Safranito” is a combination of dexterity and tactics providing the game with a new, superb playing experience. At an Indian spice booth, the players bargain for the precious ingredients they need for their exquisite meals. Thereby, everyone throws their Indian coins face-down onto the bowls depicted on the game board. The players may bluff and push the opponents’ coins aside. A clever coin thrower is able to arrange the coins on the game board in a way that allows him to do both: sell his spices at a high price and purchase cheap spices as well. Eventually, the first player wins who has been able to acquire the spices needed to serve the maharajah his desired meal.
66849.name: Safranito
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 31 -- Send Your Complaints to Brian Williams c/o NBC News
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 82

66850.name: CHem-eO
66850.description:
A new game from the makers of Booleo, this time covering organic Chemistry.

CHem-eO is a fun card game for two or more players, which demonstrates basic organic chemistry fundamentals. Players compete to build complex and simple compounds from individual atoms. Points are scored upon completing each molecule. Players may choose to play to any score they wish - a suggested goal is 92, which is the atomic number of Uranium (the heaviest naturally occurring element). If the player would like a longer game then an alternate goal could be the atomic number of the heaviest element currently discovered. Players scores are kept on the periodic table of element. Play as Carbon(Solid), Oxygen(liquid), Helium(Gas), or Nitrogen(Unknown).

The points scored as players finish building compounds come in two varieties: simple and complex. Simple compounds are common compounds which are made up of relatively few atoms. Complex compound are designated as such; either because they consist of more atoms and bonds, or because they are less well known. Complex compounds have the added difficulty of requiring the recipe card to complete. This also earns the player bonus points.

Once a compound is started it can be completed by any player which means a compound you start out to be Methane (a simple compound) may be turned into Acetic Acid (a complex compound) requiring a recipe.

Cards include single, double and triple bonds, elements, and recipes for compounds. Play is fast paced and allows the players to learn about organic chemistry while they play this fun interactive game.

boardgameissuearticle: Now We All Can be Stefan
boardgamehonor: 2010 Spiel der Spiele Hit mit Freunden Recommended
66851.description:
"Schlag den Raab - Das Spiel" is a board game based on a German TV show.
The players have to compete in different "mini-games", where they have to demonstrate knowledge and motor skills.

Among those 36 "mini-games" there is one, where players have to point to cities as exactly as possible on an empty map. In another game, you have to drop an egg and catch it. A third game is about answering rather easy questions, that are really tricky if you have no time to think about it. So for example: How many vertex has a cube? A lot of people will answer 6 instead of 8.

The "mini-games" are chosen randomly. The players score points in all these games. After the chosen number of "mini-games" is played, the one with the highest score is the winner.
66851.name: Schlag den Raab: Das Spiel
boardgamepodcastepisode: Spiele-Podcast Nr. 86: Schlag den Raab - Das Spiel (Ravensburger)

66852.name: Neuron
66852.description:
Neuron is an abstract tile placing game designed by Reiner Knizia. The players build a neural network by placing hexagonal pieces. The corners of the pieces are connected with lines in 4 different colours. For like-colored connections the players score points.
The game can also be played as single-player game.

66853.name: Halcyon Introductory Scenario
66853.description:
From the publisher's page:

This free release will take four players on a run through the Warehouse District of Halcyon as adventurers who are eager to cut their teeth and earn some credits. Perfect for those who are scoping out Halcyon and the Prodigy system.

rpgitemversion: May 2014 v0.9 Bloody Tongue Edition PDF version

Unspeakable! Episode 19: Bret Kamer of the ‘Masks of Nyarlathotep Companion’
66854.description:
From the back cover of the 2014 v0.9 Bloody Tongue edition:

“Men advised one another to see Nyarlathotep, and shuddered. And where Nyarlathotep went, rest vanished, for the small hours were rent with the screams of nightmare.” H.P. Lovecraft, 1920

“What kind of weapons do Bloody Tongue cultists use?”
“What does the Liver Ivonis contain?”
“What hospitals are there in Mombasa?”
“How do you organize a raid on Gray Dragon Island?”
“What do I do if everybody dies???”

Ever since its release in 1984, Masks of Nyarlathotep has been considered one of the finest supplements for Call of Cthulhu, a roleplaying classic. Countless players have dared to thwart the machinations of Nyarlathotep and plumb the mysteries of the Carlyle expedition. Keeping this globe-trotting campaign is unfortunately rather a challenge, with scores of NPCs, dozens of locations, hordes of cultists, and at least one very angry Outer God. Needless to say, even the best Keeper could use a little help.

That is where the Masks of Nyarlathotep Companion comes in. Drawing on the wisdom and experience of the members of Yog-Sothoth.com, the premiere site for Lovecraftian role-playing, the Companion gathers together tips and advice for Keepers wishing to run Masks of Nyarlathotep. Within these pages are detailed nearly every imaginable facet of the campaign, from starting play to ending things with a bang, explaining, exploring, and expanding the classic work. There is something for everyone, from novice game masters to Grognardian disciples of Cthulhu.

The Masks of Nyarlathotep Companion contains:

A History of the Campaign.
Keeper’s Tips for organizing and running the campaign.
Tips on how to introduce, use, and kill Jackson Elias.
Guides to New York, London, Cairo, Kenya, Australia’s Pilbara Coast, Shanghai AND Hong Kong.
Articles describing and expanding on all of the campaigns tomes and artifacts.
4 new scenarios and numerous encounters that can be inserted into the campaign.
Over two-dozen pre-generated characters plus tips on building better investigators.




Now you too can challenge (or challenge again) your players with this award-winning campaign, now with the power of the Companion at your side!


Original 2010 announcement on Yog-Sothoth.com:

The Complete Masks of Nyarlathotep is not only regarded as one of the best campaigns for Call of Cthulhu, but as one of the best campaigns to have written for gaming ever! To coincide with the 2010 re-release of the classic 1920s set campaign, Chaosium will also publish the Masks of Nyarlathotep Companion, a tome devoted in its entirety to helping a Keeper run all six chapters of Masks of Nyarlathotep. At over 250,000 words in length, the Companion is larger than the campaign itself and has been a three year labour of love for dedicated fans of both Call of Cthulhu and Masks of Nyarlathotep at the website, yog-sothoth.com.

The Companion includes a guide to running each of campaign's six chapters; detailed descriptions of the many tomes and innumerable locations to be found in the campaign; more information about our good friend, Jackson Elias; two extra scenarios set before and during the campaign; adds countless details about the campaign, such as how to handle money, travel, and the replacement of investigators in what is regarded as one of the deadliest of campaigns ever written. To that end, the Masks of Nyarlathotep Companion includes twenty-eight fully written pre-generated investigators all ready to add to the campaign, ranging from a New York Conjurer and a White Russian Folklorist to a French African gun for hire and a German ex-U-boot commander!

66855.description:
(from GMT website:)

The Dark Valley is a new game from award-winning designer Ted Raicer, focusing on the entire East Front campaign in World War II. The game components feature a beautiful map from Mark Mahaffey, stretching from Leningrad in the north to the Caucasus Mountains in the south, and around 600 counters representing every major unit that appeared during the course of the conflict. Initially most Soviet infantry are divisions, but as the game progresses these are replaced by armies and corps, so that players are not overwhelmed by the increasing Soviet Order of Battle. All German mechanized divisions are present in the game, while their infantry is a mix of division and corps.

Although the game is a semi-monster, and covers the entirety of the conflict from the launch of Barbarossa to the end of the war, the game system emphasizes playability rather than rules overhead, allowing the players to concentrate on strategy choices rather than rules minutiae.

The core of the game system is a “chit-pull” activation system. Each turn a variety of action chits are drawn, in a random order, from the Action Chit Pool, and it is this that determines the exact flow of operations on that turn. [...]

This chit-pull system imposes constant uncertainty upon the player and introduces considerable tension into the game. [...]

The Axis supply network, which imposed crucial restraints upon the effectiveness of the offensive, is represented using supply depot units.[...]

Besides the full campaign game, TDV features scenarios for Barbarossa, Case Blue, Kursk, and the Destruction of Army Group Center. Scenario start dates can also be used to explore shorter versions of the campaign.

The Dark Valley is designed to be playable and exciting, modeling the tension of the campaign elegantly and simply. The game also plays very well in solitaire mode due to the underlying chit-pull system. From the German blitzkrieg in 1941 to the blazing ruins of Berlin, The Dark Valley provides a truly new look at this much-gamed theater.

TIME SCALE: 1 or 2 months per turn
MAP SCALE: 20 miles per hex
UNIT SCALE: Divisions/Corps/Armies

COMPONENTS:

Two 22x34" maps
Three sheets of 1/2 " counters
Four Player Aid Cards
Two 6-sided dice
Rules Booklet
Players Booklet




DESIGNER: Ted S. Raicer
DEVELOPER: Paul Marjoram
MAP ART: Mark Mahaffey
COUNTER ART: Charles Kibler

66858.name: Post Office-Opoly Holiday Stamp Edition
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
66858.description:
From the Website:

The U.S. Postal Service is proud of its role in portraying
the American experience to a world audience through postage stamps. U.S. postage stamps magically transport us from sea to sea, from North to South, and everywhere in between!

POST OFFICE-OPOLY, The Holiday Stamps Edition, celebrates the magic of the Holiday Collection...

Since it’s inception in 1962, millions have enjoyed collecting, sending and receiving cards adorned with the holiday stamps.

Buy your favorite stamps, build monopolies, and increase your rent by adding Post Offices and Bulk Mail Centers...

Sounds easy enough, but throw in some "over the weight limit" packages, over-stuffed mailboxes and a temperamental dog and it gets a little more difficult and A LOT more fun!

Who knows?!? You may soon find yourself missing the seat of your pants... or you may be elected Postmaster General!

It’s YOUR roll!

66859.name: Martigan Belt
66859.description:
From the back of the book:
------ UNDER----ACK----ENS--AIL----THINK-WE------P--
CRY---LS--------------------------SABO--GE---------



This is the content of the static-garbled message received by the Janus Mining Company from one of their mining vessels in the Asteroid Belt. Your team of specialists has been assembled by all companies on Martigan III to determine what happened to the vessel and whether 'sabotage' was involved as the message seems to imply.
Included in this scenario are the full stats on the Martigan System with greatest detail on the planet Martigan III. The system map shows the location of the lost mining ship and of the IPA bases in the Asteroid Belt. Provisions exist for adventures on Martigan III, exploring other planets of the system, determining what went on with the lost ship, and mining the asteroids. Additional suggestions for other scenarios are included for use within the Martigan System.

User Summary:

Martigan Belt is a supplement for Space Opera. This 24 page adventure module centers around a team of adventurers and non-player characters investigating a distress message from a company mining ship in the Martigan system.

66860.name: Post Office-opoly Love Stamp Edition
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition

The U.S. Postal Service is proud of its role in portraying
the American experience to a world audience through postage stamps. U.S. postage stamps magically transport us from sea to sea, from North to South, and everywhere in between!

POST OFFICE-OPOLY, The Love Stamps Edition, celebrates the magic of the Love Collection... and who couldn’t use a little more LOVE!

Buy your favorite stamps, build monopolies, and increase your rent by adding Post Offices and Bulk Mail Centers...

Sounds easy enough, but throw in some "over the weight limit" packages, over-stuffed mailboxes and a temperamental bulldog and it gets a little more difficult and A LOT more fun!

Who knows?!? You may soon find yourself missing the seat of your pants...

or you may be elected Postmaster General!

It’s YOUR roll! Ya gotta LOVE it!

The U.S. Postal Service is proud of its role in portraying the American experience to a world audience through postage stamps. U.S. postage stamps magically transport us from sea to sea, from North to South, and everywhere in between!

POST OFFICE-OPOLY, The Wonders of America Stamp Edition, celebrates the spectacular "Wonders of America: Land of Superlatives" Collection...

Buy your favorite stamps, build monopolies, and increase your rent by adding Post Offices and Bulk Mail Centers... Sounds easy enough, but throw in some "over the weight limit" packages, over-stuffed mailboxes and a temperamental dog and it gets a little more difficult and A LOT more fun!

66863.name: Monster Jam-opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
66863.description:
From the Late for the Sky website:

FIRE THAT BAD BOY UP!!!

Climb in and hold on tight for one heckuva game!

It’s all the fun of a traditional property
Trading game with some huge twists!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play...
Build your own Monster Jam® fleet of monster trucks.
Buy toolboxes to upgrade your monster trucks & trade them
in to build your dream garage & maximize your fleet’s value!

Watch out for roadblocks to your championship...
Flat tires, oil & methanol refills or a false start! It’s all fun & games until you’re sent to Digger’s Dungeon®& out for 3 turns!

You’ll find the biggest & baddest monster trucks here...
The monster truck titles have fun facts about your favorite drivers & the monster trucks! This game is loud & in your face fun...

So choose your token, fire up your engine & wait for
the green light! Who knows! You may be getting three 10’s
from the judges or you may be SHUT DOWN!

Whatever happens, this is one BIG ride!

66865.name: Christmas-opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
66865.description:
From the Late for the Sky website:

It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas!

Get your lights up, your presents wrapped, gather family and friends, and pop the lid off Christmas-opoly! Watch out Players! You may be run over by a reindeer! Be nice...or you may end up with a lump of coal!

To play, collect Christmas properties, increase your property value by buying presents and trading them in for a Christmas tree. It’s all fun and games until someone blows a fuse, gets snowed in, or gets sent to 'Naughty' and is out of the game for three turns!

Whatever happens YOU BETTER NOT POUT! Christmas-opoly is a game to celebrate the season!

MERRY CHRISTMAS TO ALL!

66866.name: Insectum
66866.description:
Publisher's (Designer's) Note:
Insectum is a 24 Hour RPG challenge entry by Dennis N. Santana. It is a game that takes its inspiration from both the story games and the action games by incorporating classes, combat and magic with Scenes, Story Arcs, Tokens and much freedom for the Game Master.

It is also a game about bugpeople! In this fantasy roleplaying game, you take on the role of a human being in an odd fantasy society where everyone has traits derived from some insect or another. Characters have the power of hormonal and pheromonal supernatural abilities to help them achieve their goals & whatever their goals may be is up to the one writing the story!

66868.name: Space Ratgirls Need Our Boys!
66868.description:
A not-quite-24 hour RPG, inspired by the "Ronnies" game design event. From the opening:

"We all remember when the Drozan Empire attacked our world. A predatory alternate universe filled with a seemingly endless variety of Creatures, things that caused many to lose their faith and to believe that Lovecraft got it all right, things with powers simply too much for us to deal with. It wasn’t a fight so much as a half-hearted resistance, as they took over our world and made it their playground.

"But then, just as our backs were broken, they came. In spaceships of every size, javelin- and disc-shaped, they flew out with powers beyond our understanding. They fought back the Drozan Empire and put out the fires, propping humanity back on its feet. And then... they put themselves at our mercy. They called themselves the Trizgt, and they needed a place to rest.

"In Space Ratgirls Need Our Boys!, you play two teenaged characters: a Trizgt space warrior, and a regular unpowered human. They are a couple (for the time being). You will alternate between the two roles as the action goes on; the ratgirl exists to take the physical damage and do physical actions, and their human better halves exist to take emotional damage and take social actions. This may take place as a series of cuts.

"The central action of the game will take place in Local City High School (or, optionally, Local City University), where the Trizgt have decided to move in. Your clique consists of the PCs of you and the other players - Trizgt and the people they choose to go out with make a fairly exclusive club, and they tend not to work well as a group with other groups (although individual members may have dual memberships)."

The players roll a dice and move your ships reading the information in the squares

66875.description: Very rare propaganda board game print published by Lepthian-Schiffers in the 1930s that sought to promote economy in the use of raw materials in Germany.

66876.name: Salvespelet Kalmar 1397
66876.description:
This game was published for the life size reconstruction of Kalmar, town in south-eastern Sweden, as it was 1397 when the Nordic union was signded.
The players move their pawns around medieval Kalmar. On certain spaces they answer questions in four categories, all with connection to Kalmar and the middle ages. When all categories have been cleared a player may enter Kalmar castle and claim victory.

66879.name: Primal Rage: Rage On Urth!
66879.description:
Object: You are one of the Primal Rage Dino Beasts! Use your battle ball to wage war with the other Dino Beasts. Win the Battle and "eat" the Primal Followers! Eat the most Primal Followers and win the game!

Players first assemble the arena, which uses the actual gamebox and 2 ramps on each of the short sides of the box. Players then "wager"
their followers (1-4) and place them in the arena on marked spots. Players place one of their 4 special attack features in the appropriate
spots without looking at them. Then both players take their Beast's battle ball and roll it from the
tops of the ramp towards the arena floor.

Scores are tallied, number showing on the beast's battle ball + their special attack, and the winner "eats" all of the followers that were
knocked down in that round. Play then rotates to the 2nd player vs. 3rd player, and then 3rd vs. 4th, until all players have had 2 matches each.

The winner of the game is the one with the most "eaten" followers at
the end of the game.

66880.name: Torn Apart by Radiation Wraiths (1st Edition)
66880.description:
subtitled: An Adventure for Five Women Characters

From the introduction:

This is an introductory adventure for the upcoming Maschine Zeit Roleplaying Game by Machine Age Productions. For the sake of simplicity, the Maschine Zeit system is broken down to its most simple components. This is the heart of the high action system. While you can play a complete game with this adventure, the final Maschine Zeit product will offer more sophistication to the system.

66881.name: Historical Medieval Battles
66881.description:
A book of historical medievals scenarios including maps and orders of battle. Forty different battles are included: from Tours (732 AD) through Bosworth Field (1485 AD). Unit descriptions are based on the De Bellis Antiquitatis/Multitudinus (DBA/M) rules. The author gives the numbers of men represented per stand, so it should be easy to modify to other rules sets.

Example: Anglo-Danish army at Hastings

"Approximately 10,000 men:
6 Blade I (O), 14 Spear I (I), 1 General (Harold) Blade I (O)

Figure scale: close = 600 men, loose = 400 men, open = 200 men"

66882.name: Treasure Chests: Volume II
66882.description:
From the front cover:

As with the first volume, this product details 10 chests which can be immediately inserted into your favorite OGL/v3.5 fantasy campaign. Full
