This game is played with a standard deck of cards, including two jokers but without twos, threes and fours. Each player is dealt 14 cards. The two players with the same numbers of cards are partners, the third player is the soloist. But players do not know this until enough jokers are played.

The object of the soloist is either to win the middling number of tricks (for example, four if one partner wins five or more and the other three or fewer), or to force the partners to win the same number of tricks each. This means he can win with 14 tricks if they both win none, or with none if they both win seven.

Tricks are played and the trick is normally taken by the second-highest card of the suit led, or by the leader if nobody follows suit.

If a Joker is played, its player may decide who wins the trick. If both are played at the same trick, the soloist decide who takes the trick. Jokers cannot be led unless there are no other cards in hand.

The score is always 10 points plus the number of tricks won by the soloist (making anything from 10 to 24 points). This amount is credited to the soloist if successful, otherwise to each partner.

66953.name: Priests of Stonehenge
66953.description:
Epic building in Ancient Britain.

Players control small clans near 2 mounds -- within one they shall construct a Burial Complex for their High King, and on top of the other Stonehenge shall rise and Druids shall gather there to bless the land. To accomplish this players need to feed their population and master the Wheel. Those that do so shall earn glory in this life and beyond.

66954.name: Clue: The Card Game Mystery at Sea
66954.description:
From the box:

The famous clue suspects are all aboard Mr. Boddy's luxury yacht sailing to parts unknown. One will become a victim of foul play. What room of the yacht did the murder take place, which weapon was used, and who did it?

Was it Colonel Mustard in the galley with the oar? Or Miss Scarlet on the sun deck with the scarf? (This time, Mr. Boddy could even be the guilty party!).

Just as in the CLUE board game, you'll use a detective note sheet to track information. Action cards pace the game and provide many ways to get clues.

Be the first to figure out Who? Where? Which weapon? and you'll solve the mystery and win the game!

66955.name: Operation: Fallen Reich Main Rulebook
66955.description:
Publisher blurb:

This 128-page rulebook contains all you need to start playing. (But to be honest, although characters can be created without it we do strongly recommend the Life Board). The rules a very simple and are designed for fast role play, not slow rule play. There is also extensive background information and examples of play — all in the form of a story progressing along with the book. When you got a handle of the easy rules and have generated some interesting characters you can start playing your first scenario; The Oldest Killer, which together with a sample Character Sheet concludes this cloth-binded hardcover book.

66957.name: En Garde!
rpgissuearticle: The Name of the Game: Part Four
66957.description:
From the back of the book

En Garde! is a semi-historical game/simulation representing many of the situation of an Errol Flynn movie set in the Seventeenth or Eighteenth Centuries.

In En Garde!, a player finds himself born into and educated in a world where social climbing is a way of life, and status is a goal to be pursued over money. It is a world inhabitated by Cyrano, Roxanne, Scaramouche, Errol Flynn, Porthos, Athos, Aramis, Rhonda Fleming, Francois Villon. Constance and of course D'Artagnan. There are people to be used, friends in high places to be cultivated, enemies to be humiliated, the Cardinal's Guard to be trounced, lackies to be abused, the hand of a fair damsel to be won and the ear of the King to be gained.

Come with us now, to those vibrant, bawdy days of Yore ..

Sharpen your sword ... Sharpen your wit ... Take care not to insult a small man with a large nose ... All for one and one for all ... Good luck, friendm and may your Swash never Buckle!

66958.description:
Prepare for a long winter. Lords of Winter, the latest deluxe expansion for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, will take the cold honor of House Stark to new heights this spring!

The Lords of Winter expansion contains 165 cards (3 copies each of 55 cards), including Eddard and Catelyn Stark, Winterfell, and “The King of the North,” Robb Stark. Players of other houses will also find a wealth of new strategies, tactics, and deck-building options.

Finally, as an introduction to the art of customizing a deck, Lords of Winter offers deck lists for two exciting theme decks, one featuring the Tullys of Riverrun, and the other featuring the Direwolves of the North.
66958.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Lords of Winter
boardgameexpansion: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire

66959.name: Luppen
66959.description:
Travel friendly trivia game from Finland in Swedish for any number of players. The questions are geographical.
The pocket sized box contains a couple of hundreds cards. Each card has one answer and four questions with decreasing difficulty and point value. Answering the question at the hardest level gives 4 points, at the easiest 1 point. A game goes to an beforehand decided total e.g. 20.

66960.name: Operation: Fallen Reich Life Board
66960.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Life Board is a new way of making player characters. With it you actually play the characters mature life. Using very simple rules, a D6 and 300 unique cards you will get a character with a well defined personality, full set of skills, maybe some weaknesses and a full history. Random events and your own will are smartly balanced, resulting in very solid and stand out characters. All made in about one hour.

The Life Board box contains:
• A 89 cm × 63 cm gaming board
• 100 unique Start Cards
• 200 unique Destiny Cards
• 5 Character Sheets
• 3 special O:FR dice
• A Quick Rules Sheet

66961.name: Basic Dungeons 1
66961.description:
From the publishers website:

COPPER DRAGON brings you high quality 2D gaming tiles at a price that won’t break your gaming budget (hey, you need that money for more miniatures, right?) Featuring texture art by industry award winning artists, each set is designed to be compatible with our other terrain offerings, allowing you to make the most of your Fat Dragon Games terrain purchases.

Basic Dungeons 1 features 24 tiles, bonus rooms and optional freestanding doors. This set is the foundation of most upcoming dungeon releases in this series, so pick yours up now!

66962.name: The Orchard
66962.description:
An orchard is an artificially cultivated land where fruit trees are grown mainly to serve as human food.

The orchard has a variety of fruit species found but in particular apples, pears and cherries.

The high harvest costs, the difficult years and disease control make fruit trees fall into disuse.

Overview
You're a fruit farmer who harvests fruit (apples, pears and cherries) from a common orchard, where you struggle with fellow growers to meet the specific demand of the market to harvest healthier, tastier and better quality fruit.

Good fruit is scarce, harvesting expensive and not enough ladders available but only fruit growers know how to preserve fruit quality even when fruit tree abandonment takes place due to difficult years.

As a fruit grower you need to make sure that the quality of your fruit will be rated as high as possible and need to keep fruit harvesting costs under control.

66964.description: Ever wonder what happened to Studebakers, Packards, Ramblers, and all the rest of the “orphan” brands? Last of the Independents is a Euro-styled resource management game that simulates the building, engineering, and promotion of cars by the smaller independent American automobile companies in the post-WWII era. It depicts some of the difficult challenges executives faced as they vied against each other and the “Big Three.” Design, engineer, and advertise your way to commercial success in the wide-open car market of the Golden Age of automobiles.
66964.name: The Last of the Independents

66965.name: Millennium's End
rpgissuearticle: The Third Degree: There's No Time Like the Present
66965.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Millennium’s End is a progressive role-playing system set in a dark and dangerous future just a few short years away. This is not a fantasy game—it’s a fast-paced contemporary adventure based on today’s serious techno-thriller fiction and movies. Characters carry out investigations, espionage, and para-military operations with the most modern, high-tech equipment and resources available. The rules are sensible and detailed, cover skill use, vehicle chases, computer hacking, combat and damage with revolutionary systems that set a new standard for realism and playability. Loaded with supplementary information on technology, society, and global politics after the cold war, Millennium’s End contains a complete campaign and a ready-to-play adventure.

66966.name: 100% Fantasy Role-Playing Game System
66966.description:
From the game's introduction:

Welcome to a game system that is the first of its kind. 100% Fantasy is a game that you can enjoy with friends, without all of the formulae, complications and memorization needed by typical role-playing games. In this RPG (Role-Playing Game), a Game Designer or GD for short, hosts adventures that take place within his or her imagined setting. It is the Game Designer's first responsibility to interact with the other Game Players or GPs for short at the table - the players that take on the role of Characters composed of a few cards: one Character Card, one Heritage Card, a Defense Card, a Language and Reputation Card, several Weapon Cards and usually a stack of Items Cards that have been instilled with magical powers.

For an ideal play-experience, there are four to eight Game Players with a single Game Designer running the show. When there are more than eight Game Players, it may be advantageous for the Game Designer to have an assistant helper to be privy of the Game Designer's story and plots. The assistant often takes on the role of an antagonist (such as a monster or foe) by acting out the part to enhance the game. Since the GD has minimal downtime during an active game, the assistant can be useful to allow the Game Designer more time to make on-the-fly adjustments to the game when needed.

The Game Designer first prepares each adventure by coming up with various plot-ideas, and crafts interactive situations that may turn the story from emotional reactions to engaging battles and strategic puzzles. Just like a real storybook, the game wisps Game Players into the universe created by the Game Designer. All Character Cards exposes all ways that Game Player can interact with that particular Character (either played by a Game Designer or the Game Players).

66967.name: At the Cinema
66967.description:
Get the best seating areas in the cinema by driving fellow moviegoers from their seats. If the cinema is full, the movie starts and the game is ended.

Every moviegoer is with a group of people who all prefer to sit on the best seating areas together. The cinema hall is divided into good, fair, and poor seating areas.

You need to ensure the best seating areas to be reached before the room is full, but note you also get points for the largest group sitting together.

66969.description:
In Zagłada Atlantydy ("End of Atlantis"), players try to evacuate as many of their fellow citizens as they can - before the great cataclysm engulfs the island. Ships that are meant to ferry people to safety of the New Land are too small and few and not everybody will be able to leave Atlantis in time.

Players must compete for available space, vie for control of the Atlantean Senate, ally themselves with powerful Figures, and use every bit of influence to outsmart, outbid and outthink their opponents.

No trick is too cheap in such dire times. Players can resort to sabotage, betrayal, corruption and bribes. They can employ devious telepaths, shapeshifter spies and honor guards.

They must hurry though. The end is near and when the third "Doom!" card enters play, the game is over and the winner is decided.

Are you brave enough to lead your people to salvation?
66969.name: Zagłada Atlantydy

66970.name: Wu Xing
66970.description:
Wu Xing is the doctrine of the 5 elements named fire, water, earth, metal and wood.

Each player need to get as many element chips as possible.

You get elements chips of your played card, comparing each time the cards next to eachother whether they destroy or create elements.

There are playing cards in range from 1-9 (2x) for each element.

Sets of all elements (all 5) will earn you 5 points, metal/wood/earth 2 points, fire/water/earth 2 points, fire/water 1 point and metal/wood 1 point.

You play in turns by placing a card from your hand on your own board or on a board of a fellow player on the first free card space. Each player get a board with room for 4 cards.

A round exist out of playing all cards (4 for each player). Three rounds need to decide who gain the most points for the collected element chips.

Element creation
Fire creates Earth
Earth bears Metal
Metal carries Water
Water nourishes Wood
Wood feeds Fire

Element Destruction
Fire melts Metal
Metal chops Wood
Wood parts Earth
Earth absorbs Water
Water quenches Fire

66971.name: Shifter: Snakes & Ladders
66971.description:
From the game's introduction:

Premise: Natural born shifter born in 1700s steampunk world. At 6, whilst playing in the garden, he slides between timelines. He talks about this to others, of course, but they all assume that he just has an active imagination. At 9, when puberty hits, he forgets all about his childhood adventures, and quickly comes to believe that it was just a normal product of imagination. When he gets older, he becomes a theosophist and takes peyote. On the drug, he slides once again, but crosses a Nexus sampling point and raises the alarm. A shifter team must be dispatched to stop what's going on.

66972.name: Heroic Abilities
66972.description:
Heroic Abilities is a comprehensive expansion of the default superpowers and mental abilities plugins for the Fuzion system. As stated in the opening:

"As we all know, Fuzion is a child-system of Hero and Interlock, trying to make the best of both to create an even better system. In its infancy Fuzion showed signs of growing pains, but it stood fast and grew into a strong system of its own showing much of the beauty of its parent systems. This power system was written to expand the capabilities of the base Fuzio Super Powers Plug-In as seen in Champions: New Millenium to a more robust level similar to the power rules of the Hero System.

"Much of the mechanics of Hero ported directly over to Fuzion with little or no change, while others altered dramatically. The concept of Adders and Limiters as presented in Champions: New Millenium: Alliances has been expanded to include many of the Hero power modifiers. Overall, Heroic Abilities is an attempt to give Fuzion the robust power creation capabilities of Hero. But Heroic Abilities did not stop there - months of research in super-heroic gaming led to numerous additions, alterations, and deletions. Heroic Abilities began to take on a life of its own, with its own internal consistency that is a relative to, but not dependent on Hero System."

66973.name: Meatball Madness
66973.description:
From the manufacturer:

How long will it take for you to get all three meatballs from the cook's pot onto the customer's plate of spaghetti? Meatball Madness is a game of speed and skill! Use the air-powered ladle to float meatballs through the kitchen-themed obstacle course. The three obstacles can be placed as close or as far apart and as high and low as you want. You control the level of difficulty. Don't drop the meatball because you'll need to go back to start! The built-in timer indicates each player's time. The player who is the fastest wins!

66974.name: "Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (3rd Edition)": Players Handbook
66974.description:
From Chris Perkins' website:

My take on what 3rd edition should have been! It borrows heavily from C&C, D&D 3.X, and Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (both 1st & 2nd Edition). I do not claim to be the original author of all of this document's content. Some passages, mainly "fluff text" including the race & class descriptions, are excerpts coming from various D&D books of all editions and/or the previous source material. Their use is not meant to challenge the copyrights or trademarks of the rightful authors or owners.

66975.name: The Spawn of Fashan
66975.description:
User Summary:

A fantasy game that has been debated for decades as to whether it is serious or a joke. It is serious.

Set on the world of Fashan, this was to be "the first book in the Fashan role-playing series." It was based on the Annals of Fashan, an "upcoming series of fantasy books". This is the only volume ever published.

66976.name: Plop Grabbelpaddenstoel
66976.description: Based on a popular Belgian TV-show, Plop Grabbelpaddenstoel is a game like Bingo. Players try to be the first to complete their scorecard by drawing cards (items) from a cardboard toadstool. The amount of cards you draw is determined by dice-roll. Special cards may let you take another turn or have you clear your scorecard.

66978.name: Shadowland (Issue 7 - Oct 1997)
rpgissuearticle: The New Tools of Antisocial Behavior
66978.description:
The cover is not included in the page numbers.

Index:
Front page (Mark Nelson)
1 Index & Credits
2 Download (Editorial - Chris Hussey)
3 Expect the Unexpected (Fiction - Andrew Hamilton)
6 Getting Physical (Physical Adept powers - Ken Sato)
7 Friendship & Honor (Fiction - Steven Warnock)
12 Gen Con Wrap-up
13 Technobabel (Preview - Steven Kenson)
15 Cyberpirates Preview
17 The Knight Shift (Prime Runners - Unknown)
28 The New Tools of Anti-Social Behavior (Firearms - Brian Downes)
31 Gotcha! (Hit locations - Ben Zitterkoph, Jason Shockley)
33 Nature's Shadows (Plant Totems - Anonymous)
37 Nothing Personal - Just Business (Fiction - Jon Szeto)
46 Shadowrun CCG List (Mike Mulvihill)
49 High Noon (Fiction - Jay Fugiel)
50 Way of the hunter (Physical Adept path, skills & powers - Jonathan Szeto)
52 Hermetic Lodge (Spells - Chris Hussey)
54 Newsline (News from the Shadowrun universe)
55 Writer's Guidelines
56 Shadowland Disclosure Form

66979.name: Asia Ascendant: Psi Order Ministry & Asia Sourcebook
66979.description:
From the book: Welcome to the Center of the World
The Aberrant era ended with the actions of Chinese leaders, and in many ways the Trinity era was born (and continues to be born) in Asia. This is a place where the future is constantly taking form, even as fresh challenges loom.

66980.name: 2012: The Day of Fallout
66980.description:
2012: The Day of Fallout
Tactical game for 2-4 players

Lead one of four armies: Human Section 8, Arkanian alien race, Triad and CyberZona. Fight for domination over the Last District on Earth.

Section8 is last hope of mankind, has powerful offensive units. Arkanians - insectoid invaders form space with heavily armoured units trying to take over the earth.

Phases of game:
- choose Orders Card
- move or attack opponents
- use Strategic Command Card's

Scenarios:
- standard deathmatch for 2-4 players,
- cooperative deathmatch
- capture the flag,
- capture the region,
- escort unit,
- defend region/s
and more.

Victory is achieved by:
- implementation scenarios, or
- collecting victory points, or
- destruction of all enemy units on board

Game in Polish language version.

In box:
- 25 pieces of the map (modular board)
- 60 cards of Army (15 for each army)
- 24 cards for Strategic Action
- 16 cards of Orders (4 for each army)
- 12 cards of Teams (3 for each army)
- 5 card - walls
- 3 cards - flags
- 20 bases
- 2 dices
- 1 rulebook

Game Designer: Łukasz S. Kowal
Art designers: Łukasz S. Kowal, Agnieszka Kowal
Publisher: Essencegame

Essencegame.com

66981.name: Conflict Compatible Map: Keeper's Keep
66981.description:
This miniatures battle map is symmetric balance to provide incredible strategic combat. Each in-scale structure is well-thought out and strategically situated to add different tactical dimensions to each Conflict Match or gaming session. Though designed exclusively for the Conflict Roleplaying System, this map is versatile enough to be used with any roleplaying system that uses the standard 1 inch miniature grid (i.e., 3.5, 4e D&D, Pathfinder).


The Battlemaps are printed in full color single sided on 100# Text Stock with High-Gloss U.V. Coating.



Full Color One Side



Finished Size: 24" x 36"
Printed on 100# Text Stock (30% PCW /FSC Certified Recycled)
Includes free High-Gloss U.V. Coating
Fade-resistant Inks
This map was designed at high resolution levels and is impressively clear. Providing a realistic three dimensional feel.
Using the standard 1 inch miniature grid formation, the map is printed with the gridlines or can be downloaded without gridlines.
Top, bottom, and side coordinates are include for the use of Passcards (Conflict Hidden Movement System). The coordinates are easy-to-read and easy-to-follow map points to add to the accuracy of your player’s moves. A must have for all GMs (if we may say so ourselves! :)


Playtested for the Conflict Roleplaying Game, this map has logged over 200 Hours of playtesting time. So tactically speaking—the map flat out works!

boardgamehonor: 2011 Hungarian Board Game Award Nominee
66982.description:
"Choose your area, start your boomerangs, capture the animal ... and beware of other players.

Auction game of bluff. Players use cards with animals of two colors to win majorities and win the animal cards. A simple mechanism but players need a good self-control to get opponents to make mistakes.
66982.name: Boomerang

66985.description:
1939 marks the twilight of greatest conflict in human history. All started on September 1st 1939 in Poland when German army launched its first strike. This campaign was to prove German warfare superiority and be quick and easy "walk to Warsaw". It wasn't that quick and easy though as defeating Poland took Germans the same amount of time they needed for France - even with help of Soviet backstab on September 17th.

Game allows to play full campaign in Poland. Map covers Polish territory in 1939 and supplies full Polish, German and Soviet forces that were involved in the region. Additional Slovakia, Lithuania and Romania units that could potentially be involved are in the set as well.

There are 2 scenarios in the game: German assault on September 1st and Polish counter at Bzura river. On http://www.taktykaistrategia.pl you can get more including hipotetic conflict USSR vs. Poland (based on Polish plan "EAST") and others.

Number of scenarios was published in Taktyka i Strategia magazine:
- Plan "Zachód" (No. 34)
- Plan Porwita (No. 35)
- 17 Września (No. 33)
- Linia Wisły (No. 32)
- Atak na Prusy Wschodnie (No. 31)
- Plan "Wschód" (No. 30)
66985.name: Polska 1939

66986.description:
MERCS is a skirmish game of miniature combat taking place in the future. Games consist of two squads of 5, which have all special equipment and skills. The miniatures act simultanously, using a system of initiative and reaction to determine the exact order of turns.

MERCS uses unique cards as both reference and a means to measure. This streamlined approach means games are faster, with less rule-lawyering, providing a dynamic feel with combat that ebbs and flows. It also means that a game of MERCS is flexible; it can be played just about anywhere with any number of people. All that is needed is 1 fi g, 1 card, and 1d10.

The game board can use 3D terrain, but is equally dynamic with the provided 2D terrain cards.
66986.name: MERCS
boardgamepodcastepisode: D6G Ep 94: 2011 Best Moments & Mini Mini Reviews: Warmachine Wrath, Warhammer Badlands, & Mercs
Episode 16: Kings of Air and Steam, Tremors, and Loots and Legends

66987.name: Battle of Britain: The Hardest Day
66987.description:
The British aviation magazine, to celebrate the 50 years from the Battle of Britain, decided to offer to its readers a wargame.
In the introduction of the rules it is so descibed:
"BATTLE OF BRITAIN: THE HARDEST DAY recreates the events of 18 August 1940, the day during the Battle when the greatest number of aircraft were destroyed and damaged on either side.
Contestants are the senior Fighter Controller at 11 Group of Fighter Command, on the British side and the senior operational officer at Luftflotte 2 of the Lutwaffe, on the German side. For authenticity, in the game each of side uses the exact forces available to it on 18 August, bombers and fighters move across the map at the same rate as did the real aircraft during the Battle and each contestant has operational orders and directives similar to those of his real counterpart during this phase of the Battle of Britain. The players control pieces representing each British fighter squadron, and forces from each German bomber and fighter Geschwader, in their struggle for air superiority over the vitally important south eastern corner of England. The rules of the game have been carefully worked out to present a series of actions remarkably close to those actually fought during the Battle of Britain. With tactical skill and element of good fortune, either side can win. Devised by Dr. Alfred Price and Mike Spick."

66988.name: Basic Dungeons 2
66988.description:
From the publisher:

COPPER DRAGON: Basic Dungeons 2
COPPER DRAGON brings you high quality 2D gaming tiles at a price that won’t break your gaming budget (hey, you need that money for more miniatures, right?) Featuring texture art by industry award winning artists, each set is designed to be compatible with our other terrain offerings, allowing you to make the most of your Fat Dragon Games terrain purchases.
Basic Dungeons 2 features 24 tiles, bonus rooms and optional freestanding doors. This set expands upon Basic Dungeons 1 and allows you to layout even more complex designs than before.

66989.description: Roll the die and find your way through Bumba's circus. This educational game teaches small children about colours and letter-sounds. Based on the popular Belgian children's TV-show
66989.name: Bumba Circusspel

66990.name: Basic Dungeons 3
66990.description:
From the publisher:

COPPER DRAGON: Basic Dungeons 3
COPPER DRAGON brings you high quality 2D gaming tiles at a price that won’t break your gaming budget (hey, you need that money for more miniatures, right?) Featuring texture art by industry award winning artists, each set is designed to be compatible with our other terrain offerings, allowing you to make the most of your Fat Dragon Games terrain purchases.
Basic Dungeons 3 features 23 tiles and optional bonus tiles. This set expands on Basic Dungeons 1 & 2, and introduces multi-level room designs including a dias with altar.

66991.name: Caverns 1
66991.description:
From the publisher:

COPPER DRAGON: Caverns 1
COPPER DRAGON brings you high quality 2D gaming tiles at a price that won’t break your gaming budget (hey, you need that money for more miniatures, right?) Featuring texture art by industry award winning artists, each set is designed to be compatible with our other terrain offerings, allowing you to make the most of your Fat Dragon Games terrain purchases.
Caverns 1 features 24 tiles,allowing you to create massive cave designs. This set is the foundation of most upcoming cave releases in this series, so pick yours up now!

66994.name: Steel Deep: The Luna Sourcebook
66994.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Sling the mega-gats, boys & girls and lace up yer lead-lined treads, cuz we're takin a little trip to the moon! Here you'll find the vices baby, and plenty of 'em. From throwin' away that corporate discharge check at the roulette wheel to poppin' off some wild ordinance in the low-G trenches, this place's for you. Steel Deep lays out the who's what's & where's of Luna, the high-security-penitentiary-turned-decadent-tourist-resort. Here you'll find out about the government of gangs, the "national exports" of illegal guns and designer chemicals, and the resort's shadowy past as a secret genetic testing facility.

66995.name: Fully Strapped, Always Packed: Gats and Gear from the Underground
66995.description:
From the Back of the Book:

If you're looking for the real deal on the incredible arms and armaments of 2021, this is the package for you.

Inside, you'll find:

- Dozens of new weapons, armor types, and conflict resolution software.
- Scads of optional weapon and combat rules.
Rules for designing and building your own custom firearms.
- And a perforated "Technology" chapter that fits into the Underground Notebook.

...when heads must be flown and caps must be peeled...

66996.name: Billy: The RPG
66996.description:
Billy: The RPG is a fan-written homebrew roleplaying game set in the Billy Vs. Snakeman MMORPG. From the game's opening:

"The Billy vs Snakeman world is set on a fictional world resembling Earth. Ninja’s live and die under the rules of a village. There are many villages and all have different cultures and customs. There are a myriad of medieval weapons sharpened and shined, ready to bring down absolutely anything that tries to get into the villages, so it should be fairly safe on the inside. It’s the folks in the Countryside that have to worry about enemy ninjas during times of war. Soul Reapers are probably few and far in-between, Patrolling in small nomadic groups, or in small settlements of their own. There are non-Ninja gangs who actually relish in the countryside, with only the strongest on top, and no law enforcement to hold them back. In any case, they must practice constant vigilance, or become vittles for the next murderous pack of Ninja that they come across.

"Characters in Billy Vs Snakeman are meant to kick ass and take names, and with all that Ninja booty roaming around they can keep occupied for quite some time. It’s up to your Gamemaster (GM) whether they want to run a Dipomatic campaign or a brawler, but I feel that one of the series best draws is the crazy-awesome Humor, Bringing down dozens of Insane Idea’s at the same time and generally amusing everyone: Focus will be on being inventing and humorous. Mad fighting skills help, though."

66997.name: Tunnels & Trolls Mythical 6th Edition
66997.description:
User Summary:

Mike Hill's variant of T&T, released by James Shipman DBA Outlaw Press without license from Flying Buffalo.

The system varies from T&T 5.x and 7.x in many ways.

Attribute generation is done differently
the Types (Classes) work differently from both 5.x and 7.x
Skills system different from 7.x talents and from 5.5 and MSPE skills
Experience system is different in earning and spending
effects of level gain are different in scale than 5th ed.
Combat mechanics differ from both 5.x and 7.x
